intro: Lycium berlandieri var. peninsulare, commonly known as the Sonoran Desert枸杞, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, red, berry-like fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh desert conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native range.
